title: Moebius - Stories from Heavy Metal / Metal Hurlant [CBR]
description:
A collection of classic moebius stips from the late 70ties / early 80ties originally printed in the french magazine 'Metal Hurlant'

Explanative list of stories (In order of appaerance)

A tale of christmas - in which we learn about the intricacies of lippon hunting
Arzak - in which this classic figure is introduced for the first time
Ballade - in which an adventurous young man from the mountains joins up with a young lady of the forrest to venture forth and discover the marvels of civilization
Black Thursday - in which the game of the gods is explained in sordid details
The Emerald Lake - in which we learn about the great sacrifice of the portugese colonists
The Twinkle in Fildegaar's Eye - in which Fildegaar unvoluntarily complies with his fate
Free Fall - in which one man takes a straight downward path fullfilling the profecies of many an ancient civilization
Harzak - in which the hero effectively demonstrates how to fool a troll
The hitman I & II - in which not even the protagonists suceed at understanding what is going on
The Horny Goof I & II - in which the curses and blessings of the male reproductive organ is explained in detail
Ktulu - in which the president goes hunting
The mysteries of eroticism #2 - in which the dangerous addiction to the black juice of the mugwamp is documented
The Flora of Paradise 9 - in which we learn about barosel - the weed that lights up spontaneously
There is a prince charming on pnenoxenon - in which the dangers of travelling as acouple is explained
Rock City - in which the commercial value of rebellion is investigated
It's a small universe - in which only the dog(?) survives

Enjoy
